abstract: Scientists around the globe are protesting decision by Australia's science agency to lay off 350 researchers and shift focus from research to commercial enterprise, warning that it will imperil climate studies worldwide; move will reduce resources for both greenhouse gas measurement stations and ocean-monitoring program Argo, resulting in loss of data.

headline.print_headline: Scientists Fear Australian Cuts Imperil World Climate Studies
headline.main: Scientists Protest Cuts and Commercialization at Australian Climate Center

keywords.value: Commonwealth Scientific and Industrial Research Organization (Australia)
keywords.name: organizations

keywords.value: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change
keywords.name: subject

snippet: A decision by Australia’s science agency to lay off researchers and focus more on commerce threatens climate studies around the globe.
lead_paragraph: A decision by Australia’s science agency to lay off researchers and focus more on commerce threatens climate studies around the globe.
